messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.

You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Chief Attorney at Fey & Co.. My boss, and a very good defense attorney.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Found bent over her sister's body, crying.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 4
Name: April May
Description: An eye witness to the events. Testifies that she saw Maya commit the murder.
Character 5
Name: Marvin Grossberg
Description: A veteran defense attorney, and Mia's mentor.
Character 6
Name: Bellboy
Description: Bellboy at the Gatewater Hotel.
Character 7
Name: Redd White
Description: An eye witness. CEO of the information gathering company, Bluecorp.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: The Thinker
Description: The murder weapon. Looks like a statue, but it's actually a clock. Made by Larry Butz. Clock in the form of a statue. The clock's gears have been removed. Made by Larry Butz.
Evidence 2
Name: Glass Shards
Description: The broken remains of a glass light stand. Broken beyond all recognition.
Evidence 3
Name: Receipt
Description: A department store receipt with letters written in blood on the back. Receipt for a glass light stand. The date of purchase is the day before the murder.
Evidence 4
Name: Maya's Memo
Description: "A conversation I had with my sister is recorded on my cell phone."
Evidence 5
Name: Mia's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 9/5 at 9:00PM. Cause: single blunt force trauma. Death was instantaneous. Died from a blow by a blunt object. May have lived for a few minutes after being hit.
Evidence 6
Name: Maya's Cell Phone
Description: Holds a conversation between the Chief and Maya. Click here for details.
Evidence 7
Name: Wiretap
Description: Found in Miss May's hotel room.
Evidence 8
Name: Floor Plans
Description: The murder scene, the Fey & Co. Law Offices. [caption] The stand is blocked from view looking from the office.
If he was not in the hotel, where could he have been!?Phoenix:
In the law offices of Fey & Co., of course!
Evidence 9
Name: May Testimony
Description: "The victim dodged an attack then ran to the right, but she was caught and struck."
Evidence 10
Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" are written in pencil.
Evidence 11
Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit B" are written in pencil.
Evidence 12
Name: Bellboy's Affidavit
Description: Describes the man who stayed with Miss May in the hotel on the night of the murder.
Evidence 13
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: Article about politician's suicide. The word "White" is written in pen at the top.
Evidence 14
Name: Mia's Memo
Description: A list of people's names in Mia's handwriting.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Umm, well, see--I looked at the other window when I heard that thing fall.
Person: White
Testimony 1
Testimony: A light stand was lying on the floor when I looked.
Person: White
Testimony 2
Testimony: Then, the next moment, I saw Miss Mia run to the left!
Person: White
Testimony 3
Testimony: The killer, you, attacked her... but she dodged.
Person: White
Testimony 4
Testimony: She turned, and ran for the door!
Person: White
Testimony 5
Testimony: Then you did her in with a single blow! Thwap!
Person: White

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] [caption] Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Will:
No, it's okay. This is the real me. When I got the part of the Steel Samurai, with that mask...
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the murder, I arrived at the guard station at 1:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 1
Testimony: Poor old Hammer and the rest had been doing a run-through there since the morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 2
Testimony: I, well, I had some errands to run that morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway, it was 1:00 when I got to the guard station.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 4
Testimony: I was at the main gate from then until 5:00!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 5
Testimony: Now, the murder happened at 2:30 PM, right?
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 6
Testimony: Interesting to me, because a certain man walked right by me at 2:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 7
Testimony: It was Powers! That man right there, and he was heading toward the studio!
Person: Oldbag

Testimony 0
Testimony: The time of poor Hammer's death was 2:30 PM, true?
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 1
Testimony: The only person I saw go to the studio before then was Will Powers!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 2
Testimony: No one else went there!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 3
Testimony: If they had, I would have seen them!
Person: Oldbag

Testimony 0
Testimony: I entered the trailer, oh, a little before noon.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 1
Testimony: The meeting began at 12:00 sharp. It ended at 4:00..
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 2
Testimony: There was to be a rehearsal afterwards, so we went to Studio One.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 3
Testimony: I was fatigued, so I had Sal take me.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 4
Testimony: At 2:30, we took a 15-minute break in the meeting.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 5
Testimony: Sal and I ate t-bone steaks on the table in front of the trailer.
Person: Vasquez

Testimony 0
Testimony: I was with Sal and Oldbag, the security lady, when we found the body.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 1
Testimony: The assistant was there, too. Only Powers was absent.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 2
Testimony: I immediately called the police. Then Powers showed up.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 3
Testimony: The security lady, Oldbag, was quite agitated. Pointing at Powers, saying "he did it!"
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 4
Testimony: I asked to be left out of the proceedings.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 5
Testimony: I went back to the trailer to get my script and direction notes.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 6
Testimony: Then I went home.
Person: Vasquez
Testimony 7
Testimony: I knew that Hammer was injured and couldn't do any action scenes, so I left them behind.
Person: Vasquez

Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant until a year ago. Now she's training to be a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Dr. Turner Grey
Description: The director of the Grey Surgical Clinic where the malpractice incident occurred.
Character 2
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ran away as soon as she saw me. A girl who is Maya's little cousin.
Character 3
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Maya's aunt. She has a strange, powerful aura about her.
Character 4
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be an investigative photographer. She lives for the next big scoop.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Ini Miney
Description: College student. A huge fan of the occult and is doing research in parapsychology.
Character 7
Name: Mimi Miney
Description: Died in a car accident 1 year ago. Was Ini's older sister, nurse at Dr. Grey's clinic.
Character 8
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister. She was a top notch lawyer and my mentor and friend forever.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Became a prosecutor in Germany at age 13. A prodigy who has never known defeat.
Character 10
Name: Ami Fey
Description: Kurain Channeling Technique founder. Legend says her soul is sealed in the Sacred Urn.
Character 11
Name: Director Hotti (purported)
Description: A peculiar patient who claims to be Director Hotti. Seems to be extremely "healthy".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Guidemap (Fey Manor)
Description: A diagram of Fey Manor. Meditation room to the south. Channeling chamber north of meditation room. Side room to the east, have to go through winding path from meditation room to get to side room.
Evidence 2
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 3
Name: Newspaper Clipping 1
Description: One year ago on May 2nd, 14 patients died from malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic.
Evidence 4
Name: Folding Screen
Description: About 8 inches off the ground is a small hole that looks like a bullet hole.
Evidence 5
Name: Black Key
Description: An old steel key. A green jewel is set in the center of the key's grip.
Evidence 6
Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...? 
Evidence 7
Name: Floor Plans (Crime Scene)
Description: A diagram of the Channeling Chamber. A four sectioned mat in front of a platform at the head.
Evidence 8
Name: Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report
Description: After being stabbed in the chest, he was shot in the forehead at point-blank. Stabbed in chest then shot at point-blank. Gunpowder residue around bullet hole.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol
Description: Murder weapon. Was Grey's. Two shots fired. Bears Maya's and Grey's fingerprints.
Evidence 10
Name: Knife
Description: Murder weapon. A small fruit knife. Belongs to the Fey's. Bears Maya's fingerprints.
Evidence 11
Name: Maya's Costume
Description: Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. There are blood splatters on it. Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. [caption] It is stained with blood splatter and a bullet hole is present in the sleeve. The robe is otherwise clean. It is purple in color.
When something is shot from point blank, a burn area is left around the bullet hole.
Evidence 12
Name: Lotta's Photo 1
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is a photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot.
Evidence 13
Name: Lotta's Photo 2
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is the second photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot behind her.
Evidence 14
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: Ami Fey's spirit is sealed within. It's chipped and cracked all over. Broken by Pearl right before the murder. Under repair in the hallway until police came.
Evidence 15
Name: Cloth Scrap
Description: Unburned remains found inside the garden incinerator. Small amount of blood is on it.
Evidence 16
Name: Pearl's Ball
Description: Pearl's favorite toy. She was playing with this at the time of the murder, it seems.
Evidence 17
Name: Clothing Box
Description: There is a hole that looks like a bullet hole about 8 inches off the ground.
Evidence 18
Name: License Photo
Description: Ini's photo for her driver's license. Director Hotti's treasured possession.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: During the channeling, the defendant saw her chance to stab the victim in the chest.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: Of course, the victim used the last of his strength to fight back, sir.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: While the two were fighting, the victim took out his gun.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
